dialogueSequence.sentence: Master, I’ve brought an able soul and his mutt for training.
Wazzat?  New ‘prentices?  I don’t need no new ‘prentices.
You’ll be glad, we won’t even make you mad!
With a rhyme scheme like that you will. That’s why I usually don’t take ‘prentices.
They get in the way of hearty drink and good song.
Bark Bark (I didn’t expect to find the second stone on a lousy drunk.)
Don’t tell me you took the stone from ol’ Harry in the forest?
He turned red, we made him dead.
He was the only one who understood my woes. In that case, you’re all my foes!
Woof Grrr (Maybe once he’s dead I’ll have these infernal rhymes out of my head.)
